e4: As a board member, ethical considerations should outweigh short-term investor gains. While the current policy might appease investors accustomed to manipulated earnings, it fosters a culture of untruthfulness and potentially exposes the company to legal repercussions. Shifting to an unbiased reporting system, despite potential initial confusion, demonstrates integrity and builds trust with stakeholders in the long run.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency and honesty.  It reflects a company's true financial performance without manipulation or misleading practices, allowing stakeholders to make informed decisions.  Considerations include clearly communicating any changes in accounting policies and ensuring the chosen methods align with generally accepted accounting principles. Building trust and long-term value should always be paramount.
e6: Yes, I would ask: 1) What steps are planned to communicate the new policy to investors and address potential confusion?  2) How will the company mitigate the risk of retail investors being disadvantaged by sophisticated investors who may understand the policy change?
